title: Prayer for the International Day of Democracy, by Rabbi Lior Bar-Ami
author: Lior Bar-Ami

coauthors.name: Lior Bar-Ami
coauthors.bio: Rabbi Lior Bar-Ami is a Reform/Liberal movement rabbi in Europe. He was ordained at Abraham-Geiger-College in Berlin, Germany in 2016. Rabbi Bar-Ami has served as rabbi for The Liberal Synagogue in Toulouse, France and Or Chadash Synagogue in Vienna, Austria.

excerpt: A civic prayer for the International Day of Democracy, a civic day observed internationally on September 15th. . . .
content:
Contribute a translation Source (English)
Source of life and justice,
On this day, we honor the values of democracy—
A system that upholds the dignity and worth of every person,
And calls upon each of us to actively shape the future we share.
May democracy be a space where diversity flourishes,
Where every voice is heard and valued,
No matter one’s background, belief, or origin.
Let our differences be a source of strength,
Enriching the fabric of our society.
Grant wisdom and humility to those in positions of leadership.
May integrity and accountability guide their decisions,
And may they serve with justice and compassion.
Let each citizen embrace the responsibility to participate fully,
Not as passive followers, but as partners in the pursuit of a just and equitable world.
Help us protect the freedoms that sustain democracy—
The freedom to speak, to believe, to gather, and to dissent—
And let us be ever mindful of our duty to safeguard these rights for all.
May we look beyond our own borders,
Understanding that the challenges we face are shared by the global community.
Let us work together, across nations and cultures,
For the common good, for peace, and for the justice we all deserve.
In times of division and strife,
Grant us the strength to seek healing and reconciliation.
Help us to repair the bonds that have been broken,
And to build bridges where there is misunderstanding and mistrust.
For in unity and mutual respect, democracy finds its truest expression.
